text: Brain organoids are helping researchers, but their use also creates unease - NPR
fullText: Pea-size clusters of human cells called brain organoids inspire both hope and fear. Experts are debating how scientists can responsibly use these bits of gray matter.

text: U.S. interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean haven't always gone as planned - NPR
fullText: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.

text: What Is the ‘Super Flu’ That Is Spreading in Europe and the United States? - wired.com
fullText: The “super flu” behind outbreaks in the US and UK is a new variant of influenza A H3N2, subclade K. Existing vaccines appear to be insufficiently effective against the virus.
